list_definition.definition: an underground passage eg for pedestrians, under a busy road
an underground railway in a city

list_ex_of_english: In recent years, we, for our part, have done what we can to improve the design of subways.
They live in the underground sewage systems and subways in the winter and survive by begging.
While one of the timed walks went into an underground station and through a subway, the second remained outdoors, to create an acoustic disjunction.
I am told that what will swing it will be when the dollar is a minimum basic amount for subway fares.
In contrast, in winter she prefers the subway.
Relates to railroads, street railways, subways, streetcars, and fares; includes bills regulating automobile operation and driving.
For both, the subway afforded them a novel form of visuality.
Some of these children cross this road by a subway, others by special transport, and others at a crossing supervised by a traffic warden.
